page.title: 11An interveiw with a Farmer.
page.content:
Mr. Beale has lived at Stone House Farm, Ashorne for 40 years. He says that the farm was built in the 1500's.
He owns 180 acres and rents a further 160 acres. This year his flock of sheep produced 350 lambs. He grows winter barley and cultivates grass for winter feed to his sheep. On the farm there is one milking cow that has calved this year. The cow provides them with milk for the home.
Mr. Beale gets rather angry with people who do not keep to footpaths.
He was cross also when a manned hot air balloon landed among his sheep. The animals were so frightened that the ewes became separated from their lambs.
